verses.verse: And when Balaam<WH1109> saw<WH7200> that<WH3588> it pleased<WH2895> <WH5869> the LORD<WH3068> to bless<WH1288> <WH853> Israel,<WH3478> he went<WH1980> not,<WH3808> as at other times,<WH6471> <WH6471> to seek<WH7125> for enchantments,<WH5173> but he set<WH7896> his face<WH6440> toward<WH413> the wilderness.<WH4057>

And Balaam<WH1109> lifted up<WH5375> <WH853> his eyes,<WH5869> and he saw<WH7200> <WH853> Israel<WH3478> abiding<WH7931> in his tents according to their tribes;<WH7626> and the spirit<WH7307> of God<WH430> came<WH1961> upon<WH5921> him.

And he took up<WH5375> his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559> Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> hath said,<WH5002> and the man<WH1397> whose eyes<WH5869> are open<WH8365> hath said: <WH5002>

He hath said,<WH5002> which heard<WH8085> the words<WH561> of God,<WH410> which<WH834> saw<WH2372> the vision<WH4236> of the Almighty,<WH7706> falling<WH5307> into a trance, but having his eyes<WH5869> open: <WH1540>
How <WH4100> goodly<WH2895> are thy tents,<WH168> O Jacob,<WH3290> and thy tabernacles,<WH4908> O Israel!<WH3478>

As the valleys<WH5158> are they spread forth,<WH5186> as gardens<WH1593> by<WH5921> the river's<WH5104> side, as the trees of lign aloes<WH174> which the LORD<WH3068> hath planted,<WH5193> and as cedar trees<WH730> beside<WH5921> the waters.<WH4325>

He shall pour<WH5140> the water<WH4325> out of his buckets,<WH4480> <WH1805> and his seed<WH2233> shall be in many<WH7227> waters,<WH4325> and his king<WH4428> shall be higher<WH7311> than Agag,<WH4480> <WH90> and his kingdom<WH4438> shall be exalted.<WH5375>

God <WH410> brought him forth<WH3318> out of Egypt;<WH4480> <WH4714> he hath as it were the strength<WH8443> of a unicorn:<WH7214> he shall eat up<WH398> the nations<WH1471> his enemies,<WH6862> and shall break<WH1633> their bones,<WH6106> and pierce them through<WH4272> with his arrows.<WH2671>

He couched,<WH3766> he lay down<WH7901> as a lion,<WH738> and as a great lion:<WH3833> who<WH4310> shall stir him up?<WH6965> Blessed<WH1288> is he that blesseth<WH1288> thee, and cursed<WH779> is he that curseth<WH779> thee.

And Balak's<WH1111> anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against<WH413> Balaam,<WH1109> and he smote his hands together:<WH5606> <WH853> <WH3709> and Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Balaam,<WH1109> I called<WH7121> thee to curse<WH6895> mine enemies,<WH341> and, behold,<WH2009> thou hast altogether blessed<WH1288> <WH1288> them these<WH2088> three<WH7969> times.<WH6471>

Therefore now<WH6258> flee<WH1272> thou to<WH413> thy place:<WH4725> I thought<WH559> to promote thee unto great honor;<WH3513> <WH3513> but, lo,<WH2009> the LORD<WH3068> hath kept thee back<WH4513> from honor.<WH4480> <WH3519>
And Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Balak,<WH1111> Spoke<WH1696> I not<WH3808> also<WH1571> to<WH413> thy messengers<WH4397> which<WH834> thou sentest<WH7971> unto<WH413> me, saying,<WH559>

If <WH518> Balak<WH1111> would give<WH5414> me his house<WH1004> full<WH4393> of silver<WH3701> and gold,<WH2091> I cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> go beyond<WH5674> <WH853> the commandment<WH6310> of the LORD,<WH3068> to do<WH6213> either good<WH2896> or<WH176> bad<WH7451> of mine own mind;<WH4480> <WH3820> but what<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> saith,<WH1696> that will I speak?<WH1696>

And now,<WH6258> behold,<WH2009> I go<WH1980> unto my people:<WH5971> come<WH1980> therefore, and I will advertise<WH3289> thee what<WH834> this<WH2088> people<WH5971> shall do<WH6213> to thy people<WH5971> in the latter<WH319> days.<WH3117>

And he took up<WH5375> his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559> Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> hath said,<WH5002> and the man<WH1397> whose eyes<WH5869> are open<WH8365> hath said: <WH5002>

He hath said,<WH5002> which heard<WH8085> the words<WH561> of God,<WH410> and knew<WH3045> the knowledge<WH1847> of the most High,<WH5945> which saw<WH2372> the vision<WH4236> of the Almighty,<WH7706> falling<WH5307> into a trance, but having his eyes<WH5869> open: <WH1540>

I shall see<WH7200> him, but not<WH3808> now:<WH6258> I shall behold<WH7789> him, but not<WH3808> nigh:<WH7138> there shall come<WH1869> a Star<WH3556> out of Jacob,<WH4480> <WH3290> and a Scepter<WH7626> shall rise<WH6965> out of Israel,<WH4480> <WH3478> and shall smite<WH4272> the corners<WH6285> of Moab,<WH4124> and destroy<WH4272> all<WH3605> the children<WH1121> of Sheth.<WH8352>
And Edom<WH123> shall be<WH1961> a possession,<WH3424> Seir<WH8165> also shall be<WH1961> a possession<WH3424> for his enemies;<WH341> and Israel<WH3478> shall do<WH6213> valiantly.<WH2428>
Out of Jacob<WH4480> <WH3290> shall come he that shall have dominion,<WH7287> and shall destroy<WH6> him that remaineth<WH8300> of the city.<WH4480> <WH5892>

And when he looked on<WH7200> <WH853> Amalek,<WH6002> he took up<WH5375> his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559> Amalek<WH6002> was the first<WH7225> of the nations;<WH1471> but his latter end<WH319> shall be that he perish<WH8> forever.<WH5703>

And he looked on<WH7200> <WH853> the Kenites,<WH7017> and took up<WH5375> his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559> Strong<WH386> is thy dwelling place,<WH4186> and thou puttest<WH7760> thy nest<WH7064> in a rock.<WH5553>
Nevertheless <WH3588> <WH518> the Kenite<WH7014> shall be<WH1961> wasted,<WH1197> until<WH5704> <WH4100> Asshur<WH804> shall carry thee away captive.<WH7617>
And he took up<WH5375> his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559> Alas,<WH188> who<WH4310> shall live<WH2421> when God<WH410> doeth<WH4480> <WH7760> this!

And ships<WH6716> shall come from the coast<WH4480> <WH3027> of Chittim,<WH3794> and shall afflict<WH6031> Asshur,<WH804> and shall afflict<WH6031> Eber,<WH5677> and he<WH1931> also<WH1571> shall perish<WH8> forever.<WH5703>
And Balaam<WH1109> rose up,<WH6965> and went<WH1980> and returned<WH7725> to his place:<WH4725> and Balak<WH1111> also<WH1571> went<WH1980> his way.<WH1870>
